intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana subvar. montana, commonly known as the mountain eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
